list_definition.definition: a small lever, handle or other device eg for putting or turning an electric current on or off

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The switch is down when the power is on and up when it’s off

list_definition.mean_english: sự di chuyển, thay đổi đột ngột
list_definition.definition: an act of turning or changing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: After several switches of direction they found themselves on the right road.
He switched the lever to the ‘off’ position
Let’s switch over to another programme
Having considered that problem, they switched their attention to other matters.

list_ex_of_english: Finally, switching behavior is important for risk adjustment.
What can also complicate the task of exiting a relationship are the costs of switching resources to another relationship.
Most pension funds have found a solution by switching to an average-wage plan with solvency-contingent indexation and contributions.
We searched for interaction efforts between modules; the flexible frame switches naturally, without actuating it.
Varying combinations of muscle groups were stimulated and foot switches were used to trigger each channel at the appropriate period of the gait cycle.
Generally, switching is only possible when an employee moves to an employer connected to a different pension fund.
Rapid camera switching enables an average of 50 data points per camera to be collected for each field.
We see that the optimal policy is switching between stations 1 and 2 three times, so it is not characterized by a single switching curve.
